result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan A Ludwig

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Andrew M Murphy in court.  Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court questions regarding non-representation.  Defendant does not qualify for a PD attorney.  Defendant has completed an Affidavit of Indigency. Court does not find defendant indigent.  Court will proceed with the option of having the matter reheard.

CASE NOS. 22CF449 & 22CF450 ARE BEING HEARD AT THE SAME TIME.

1:59 PM Defendant Michael D Stoflet Jr in court.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for Michael D Stoflet Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin. Andrew Murphy appears in person, unrepresented.  Lt Kevin Hamill is sworn and questioned by Attorney Mogard.  Testifies on May 11, 2019 an employee at M&R Entertainment stated the building had been broken into.  Testifies that a gray minivan and a safe were stolen.  Testifies to the amount of cash that was in the safe.  Testifies to what the video surveillance depicted.  Testifies to the damage to the business and minivan.  Witness identifies the defendant, Michael Stoflet, in the courtroom.  Witness identifies defendant, Andrew Murphy, in the courtroom.  Testifies to the interviews conducted in this matter.  Cross-examination by Attorney Moertel.  Questions witness regarding who identified Holly's vehicle.  Questions witness regarding specifics of Holly's statements to law enforcement.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it.  Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Must be released and go straight to treatment and needs to give proof to the jail of being accepted into treatment.

10:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan A Ludwig appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Ryan A Ludwig. 
Not guilty plea is entered. Attorney Weiland requests a bond modification.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Ryan A Ludwig appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Conover is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Grand Rapids Police Department. Testifies to being going to a location for a possible overdose. Testifies to arriving on scene and seeing two other officers giving CPR to the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the defendants wife being on scene. Testifies to his wife's statement. Testifies to the defendants bag in his vehicle being searched. Testifies to a syringe found w/ liquid in it. Testifies to the liquid being tested and the results. Testifies to other contraband found in the defendants bag. Testifies to another substance that was found and tested and the results. Testifies to the defendant stating what the white powdery substance was. Testifies to finding marijuana in a cigarette pouch. Testifies to testing that and the results.
Attorney Oswald requests the court take judicial notice of another case of the defendants, court grants.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
This matter will be set for arraignment to give the defendant time to get an attorney.
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. lute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $500
